PROPERTY.name: clientId
PROPERTY.DESC: Returns the current sync client id.

PROPERTY.name: haveLocalChanges
PROPERTY.DESC: Returns true if any of the Rhodes model objects have local database changes that need to be synchronized, false otherwise.

METHOD.name: databaseFullReset
METHOD.DESC: Deletes all records from the property bag and model tables.

PARAM.name: resetClientInfo
PARAM.DESC: true to clean the client_info table, false otherwise.

PARAM.name: resetLocalModels
PARAM.DESC: true to clean local (non-synced) models, false otherwise.

METHOD.name: databaseFullResetAndLogout
METHOD.DESC: Deletes all records from the property bag and model tables. For examples, see Resetting the Database in Using the Local Database with ORM.

METHOD.name: databaseFullclientResetAndLogout
METHOD.DESC: Reset the Rhodes model database and logout. Equivalent to ORM::ORM.database_full_reset(true) followed by SyncEngine.logout.

METHOD.name: databaseFullResetEx
METHOD.DESC: Deletes all records from the property bag and model tables, if models are set then reset only selected models.

PARAM.name: models
PARAM.DESC: Array of models names to reset.

PARAM.name: reset_client_info
PARAM.DESC: If set to true, client_info table will be cleaned.

PARAM.name: reset_local_models
PARAM.DESC: If set to true, local(non-synced models) will be cleaned.

METHOD.name: addModel
METHOD.DESC: Javascript using only. Creates ORM model.

SECTION.DESC: Delete all Rhodes model objects for a source, filtering by conditions.

EXAMPLE.title: Add ORM model, create ORM object

SECTION.DESC: This example describes creating model and adding model object.

CODE.RUBY:
class Product include ORM::PropertyBag end
product = Product.create( :manufacturer => 'Apple', :name => 'iPhone5', :price => 199.99)
readedProduct = Product.find(:first) readedProduct.manufacturer #=> "Apple" readedProduct.name #=> "iPhone5"
